episode_title: 301 - The One With the Princess Leia Fantasy

credits.writtenBy: Michael Curtis and Gregory S. Malins

note: [Scene Central Perk, the whole gang is entering]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m tellin’ ya that girl totally winked at me.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Did not, she did not wink at you…(sees that their sacred couch is occupied by strangers).

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Huh. (They all leave, dejected)

content.description: Rachel and Monica’s, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I have to say Tupolo Honey by Van Morrison.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nooo Way! The most romantic song ever is The Way We Were.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See, I-I think that one that Elton John wrote for, um, that guy on Who’s The Boss.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What song was that, Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hold me close, young Tony Dan-za.
(Monica enters from her bedroom)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi Monica!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Mon!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Mon!
(she just walks straight into the bathroom)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, has she slept at all?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, it’s been three nights in a row.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, she finally stopped crying yesterday, but then she found one of Richard’s cigar butts out on the terrace, so.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay that explains it. I got a call at two in the morning, but all I could hear was, like, this high squeaky sound, so I thought okay its like a mouse or a opossum. But then I realized where would a mouse or a opossum get the money to make the phone call.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is coming in from the bedroom

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Morning.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Morning, hey, you made pancakes?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, like there’s any way I could ever do that.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Monica and Rachel had syrup, now I can get my man to cheer up. (laughs hysterically) Good morning Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good morning.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you know what, here’s a thought. Why don’t you stay home from work today and just hang out with me.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, I wish. Look, honey, you have that report to finish, and I gotta go see my lawyer.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can not believe that I am going out with someone that is getting divorced. I’m such a grown up.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I-I-I gotta go, I gotta go. Okay, not without a kiss.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, maybe I won’t kiss you, and then you’ll have to stay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Kiss her! Kiss her!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I’ll see you later, sweetie. Bye Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: B-bye Janice. So when ya’ dumpin’ her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nope, not this time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on, quite yankin’ me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not yanking you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is Janice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I know. She makes me happy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. All right. You look me in the eye and tell me, without blinking, that you’re not breaking up with her. No blinking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not breaking up with her! (they stare at each other for a while, then Joey blows in his face)

content.description: Rachel and Monica’s, Monica is entering from the bathroom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: God, look what I found in the drain.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s some of Richard’s hair! (holds it close to Ross) What do I do with this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Getting it away from me would be job one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s weird, but you know what I don’t wanna throw this away. I mean this is like all I have left of him, gross, drain hair. Ooh! (drops it in Ross’s cereal)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh. Oh. It looks like, like a tiny little person drowning in your cereal. (Ross gives her this look, like ‘Yeah, doesn’t it’, and gets up to dump it down the drain.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: God, what is wrong with me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You need to get some sleep.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I need to get some Richard.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, you broke up with him for a reason.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, I know. I’m just so tired of-of missing him. I’m tired of wondering why hasn’t he called. Why hasn’t he called!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe, because you told him not to.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you the memory woman?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Their not breaking up. Chandler and Janice. Their not breaking up. He didn’t blink or anything.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you know I’m not surprised. I mean have you seen them together, they’re really cute.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cute! This is Janice! You remember Janice?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, Joey, I remember, she’s annoying, but you know what she’s-she’s his girlfriend now. I mean what can we do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There you go! That’s the spirit I’m looking for! What can we do? Huh? All right who’s first? Huh? Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I’m thinking that Chandler’s our friend and Janice makes him happy, so I say we just all be adult about it and accept her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, we’ll call that Plan B. All right?

content.description: Ross’s bedroom, Ross is working and Rachel is reading a book in bed

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, I was wondering…
content.parenthetical: she leans over and kisses him on the cheek

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmm?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you still have that, um, Navy uniform?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nooo, I had to return it to the costume place.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmm.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think I have an old band uniform from high school.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You remember not having sex in high school, right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well honey, what about you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean do you have any fun, you know, fantasy type things?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on you gotta have one!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, you know what…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …if you tell me, I might do it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, umm. Did you ever see, um, Return Of The Jedi?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do you remember the scene with, um, Jabba the Hut? Well Jabba had as, as his prisoner, um, Princess Leia.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oooh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Princess Leia, was wearing this, um, gold bikini thing. It was pretty cool.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are there

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, oh, Princess Leia and the gold bikini, every guy our age loved that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, um. It’s huge. Yeah, that’s the moment, when-when, you know she stopped being a princess, and became, like, a woman, you know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did you ever do the-the Leia thing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah, um-mm. Oh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really! That-that great huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No it’s just that I got this new pager and I have it on vibrate. See ya!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi you guys!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look who I found standing outside of the Szechwan Dragon staring at a parking meter.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mon. Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why aren’t you at work?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, they-they sent me home.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because I don’t work at the Szechwan Dragon.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You really, really need to get some sleep, honey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know I do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Guess what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: They published my paper.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, really, let me see, let me see.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rach, look! (she holds two buns up to her ears to make her hair look like the Princess Leia ’do.) Oh, hi! Where is my strong Ross Skywalker to come rescue me. (Ross stands up horrified) There he is.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is watching Wheel of Fortune, the puzzle is showing _oun_ Rush_ore.

content.text: [Chandler enters]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wheel!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Of!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fortune! This guy is so stupid. (yelling) It’s Count Rushmore!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, you should really go on this show. All right, listen, I got three tickets to the Rangers tonight. What’d ya’ say?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I say, ‘I am there!’ Cool! Aw, is Ross going to?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, Janice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Jan-ice. ’Cause I, just, I feel bad for Ross, you know, we-we always go together, we’re like the three hocke-teers.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, I may be way out on a limb here, but do you, do you, have a problem with Janice?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, Yeeees. God, how do I say this. (walks into the kitchen, Chandler follows closely, he turns around and gets startled). Oh, hi, you know that girl from the Greek restaurant with the hair (holds his hands up to signify she has big hair)?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, that girl that I hate, eww, drives me crazy, eww, eww, oh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I don’t hate Janice, she’s-she’s just a lot to take, you know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, there you go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hey. Come on man, don’t look at me like that, she used to drive you nuts before too, remember?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m crazy about her now. I think this could be the real thing. Capital ‘R’! Capital ‘T’! (Joey stares at him) Don’t worry, those are the right letters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, what do you want me to say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I want you to say that you like her!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t. It’s like this chemical thing, you know. Every time she starts laughing, I just wanna (grimaces and tenses up) pull my arm off just so that I can have something to throw at her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks for trying. (grabs the ticket and starts to leave) Oh, and by the way there is no Count Rushmore!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, then-then who’s the guy that painted the faces on the mountain? (Chandler gives him a look like ‘You stupid idiot!’)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel and Ross are entering

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How could you have told her?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, I didn’t think it would that big of a deal.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, she didn’t think it would be that big of deal.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, who are you talking to when you do that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, that was supposed to be like a private, personal thing between us.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, Ross, Phoebe is my girlfriend, okay, we tell each other everything. You know, I mean, come on, guys do the same thing, I mean, what about all that locker room stuff.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s different, okay. That’s like, uh ‘Who dated a stripper?’ or ‘Who did it on the back of the Staton Island Ferry?’.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Were both of those Joey?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Look, you don’t, you don’t talk about like, you know, your girlfriend and the intimate stuff you, you do with her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Not even with your best friend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Noo!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is so sad. Your missing out on so much, Ross. I mean, the bonding and the sharing, you know. And-and knowing that someone else is going through the same thing you are.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmph. So what you, you tell each other everything?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pretty much.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did you talk about the night of five times? Do you tell people about the night of five times?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, honey, yeah that was with Carol.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know, but it’s still worth mentioning, I think.

content.description: Monica’s bedroom, Phoebe is trying to relax her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Relax every muscle in your body. Listen to the plinky-plunky music. Okay, now close you eyes, and think of a happy place. Okay, tell me your happy place.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Richard’s living room, drinking wine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. No, no, no, not a Richard thing, just put down the glass. And get out!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, but that’s my happy place.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, okay, fine, use my happy place. Okay, I’m just gonna, I have to ask that you don’t move anything.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I’ll try not to.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, all right, so, your in a meadow, millions of stars in the sky…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you think breaking up with him was a huge mistake?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, there are no questions in the happy place. Okay, just, the warm breeze, and the moonlight flowing through the trees…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll bet he’s totally over me, I’ll bet he’s fine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, betting and wagering of any kind, are, I’m sure, not permitted in the happy place. Okay. Just-just, you know, the-the lovely waterfalls, and the, the trickling fountains. And the-the calming sounds of the babbling brook…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, this isn’t working. I’m still awake and now I have to pee.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: So, I hear, you hate me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I, ah, I never said hate, I was very careful about that.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: A little birdie told me something about you wanting to rip your arm off and throw it at me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And you got a ‘hate’ from that?! Your taking a big leap there…

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: All right, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, we’ve got to do something about our little situation here Joey. So, this is my idea: you and me spending some quality time together.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But what does that gonna do…

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: For Chandler!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. I’m in.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Okay. All right. This is what we’re gonna call it: ‘Joey and Janice’s DAY OF FUN! ’

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Does it have to be a whole day?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Yes, because that’s how long it takes to love me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I know, I sleep in the next room.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel and Monica are entering

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, I went down to the post office, and it turns out it was those videos that I ordered for Richard about the Civil War. He loved the Civil War.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica, do you want us to take you home?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, huh. (to Ross) Or maybe to a galaxy far, far away. (Rachel, Monica, and Phoebe leave)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Women tell each other everything. Did you know that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Umm, yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No Chandler, everything! Like stuff you like, stuff she likes, technique, stamina, girth…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Girth? Why, why, why, wh-why, why, why, why would they do this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel says sharing’s great and supposedly, you know, we outta be doing it. Do you wanna?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re not gonna talk about girth are we?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nooo!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! All right! You go first.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, I’ll go first.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, uh, the other night Rachel and I are in bed talking about fantasies, and I happened to describe a particular Star Wars thing…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Princess Leia in the gold bikini.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! Wow, well, that-that was easy. Okay, you-you go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, you know, you know when your in bed, with a woman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmph.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And, ah, you know, your fooling around with her. And you get all these like, mental images in your brain, you know, like Elle MacPherson, or that girl at the Xerox place…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: With the belly-button ring? Oh, muhawa!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know, And then all of the sudden your Mom pops into your head. And your like ’mom, get outta here!’ You know, but of course, like, after that you can’t possibly think of anything else, and you can’t, you know, stop what your doing. So it’s kinda like, you’re, you know. You know…(Ross just stares at him). You don’t know!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Your Mom, your telling me, your telling me, about your Mom, what is the matter with you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You said…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I said ‘ share ’ not ‘ scare ’. Go sit over there! (Chandler goes over and sits at a table and puts his head down).

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey and Janice are returning from their DAY OF FUN!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: We’re baack!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you guys doing together?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Joey and Janice’s DAY OF FUN !!! (laughs)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, yeah. We went to a Mets game, we got Chinese food, and you know, I love this woman. You have got competition buddy.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I just came by to give you a kiss, I have to go pick up the baby, so. I’ll see you later sweetheart, you too Chandler. (laughs)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You still can’t stand her can you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry man, I tired, I really did.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you know, I appreciate you giving it a shot.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But, hey, look, you know the good thing is, is that we spent the whole day together and I survived, and what’s even more amazing, so did she. It was bat day at Shea Stadium.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I guess that’s something.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No man, that’s huge! Now, I know I can stand to be around her, which means I get to hang out with you, which is kinda the whole point, anyway.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hey, Chandler, we, ah, we stopped by the coffee shop and ran into Ross.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, if it makes you feel any better, I do it too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, I always picture your Mom when I’m having sex.

content.description: [Scene: Rachel and Monica’s, Monica is watching the Civil War videos]

content.speaker: Video
content.text: April Twelve, Eighteen hundred, Sixty-One (Monica lights Richard’s cigar butt), 4:30 A.M. on Tuesday, the United States garrison at Fort Sumter was fired upon (knock on door) it is now under bombardment by…
(Monica answers the door)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, Dad, what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, it’s your mother’s bridge night so I thought that I would come into the city for a little Monicuddle. (hugs her) Since when did you start smoking cigars?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t, I just, I just like the smell of them. So, uh, what are you really doing here Dad?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, I just wanted to make sure you were okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What makes you think that I might not be okay?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I saw Richard.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: So, how are you doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m fine, just a little tired, I’m okay. How’s Richard doing?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: You don’t wanna know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I really, really do.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, he’s doing terrible!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Worse than when he broke up with Barbara.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re not just saying that are you?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: No, the man is a mess.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Was he crying?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, do you think he was waiting ’til after you left, so he could cry?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Maybe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think so.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Honey, relationships are hard. Like with your Mom and me. You know after we graduated college we broke up for a while. It seems her Father, your Grandfather, wanted her to travel around Europe, like he did. Of course, he got to do it on Uncle Sam’s nickel, because he was also strafing German troop trains at the time. However, (turns around and sees that Monica is sleeping and puts a blanket around her, kisses her, picks up the cigar, and starts watching the video)

content.description: Ross’s bedroom, Ross is humming the Star Wars theme. Rachel enters, with her hair done up like Princess Leia’s, and wearing a belly dancer’s outfit, to simulate the gold bikini thing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, here we go. I’m Jabba’s prisoner, and you have a really weird look on your face. What? Honey, what is it? Did I get it wrong? Did I get the hair wrong? What? Did you just picture it differently? What? What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no it’s, um, it’s not you, um, it’s um, it’s (turns and sees his Mom standing where Rachel is)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well what is it? Come on sweetie, your like, freaking me out here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I hate Chandler, the bastard ruined my life. (Rachel starts looking around and down, with a ‘What the hell is going on?’ look on her face.)
